intro: Paneion bulbosum, commonly known as the bulbous paneion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground storage organs. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with six petals arranged in a star shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
